body.p: Since the write request is distributed evenly across all channels and targets, data should be written evenly to all virtual targets. Depending upon the traffic pattern, virtual blocks across different targets may not be erased evenly. The priority based wearleveling works within a virtual target only. In order to perform wearleveling across virtual targets, the average erase count of all virtual targets is maintained. When the average erase count of a virtual target is higher than a high water mark threshold, the virtual target is skipped for every other write request. When the average erase count falls below a low water mark threshold, the virtual target can be written on every write request.
